title: Shio-Mgvime monastery
description: Monastery near the town of Mtskheta in Georgia. According to tradition, the monastery was founded in the 6th century CE by St. Shio the Anchorite. It was one of Georgia's largest monastic communities in the early Middle Ages, and it remained in active use throughout the Medieval and Early Modern periods.

properties.description: Point representing the location of Shiomgvime Monastery, derived from an OpenStreetMap node.
properties.title: OSM location of შიომღვიმე (Shio-Mgvime Monastery)
